projectGridLines.title: Product & Growth - New Categories
projectGridLines.description:
Description: Scapia is uniquely placed as a cobranded credit card plus commerce offering that has deep insights and relationships with its card members. The new categories team launches new commerce opportunities in travel, merchandising, financing, and travel adjacencies to find the best new categories for Scapia, and independently scales them to meaningful contribution. 


In this vertical, you will work with qualitative and quantitative consumer insights to figure out new categories. You will then work on the product launch and iterations, and figure out GTM techniques to make the category meaningful.


Skill sets: Great data and analytics skills (query languages, analytics tools etc), consumer research, growth tools (Social, CRM), Sales-ability (BD, Inside Sales), Marketing (Email, SMS,  WA)


Traits expectation: Structured problem solving, data-driven and analytical, great communicator, high tolerance for ambiguity, willingness to do lots of primary consumer research, knowledge of growth tools (Social, CRM etc)


Expected learning: an opportunity to grow a category from scratch, hone entrepreneurial skills and gather end to end ownership of product building, strategy driving and build a commerce business.


Specific courses required for project execution:  Product thinking, analytical thinking, English communication skills

projectGridLines.title: Business Strategy Intern
projectGridLines.description:
Description: As a cobranded credit card entity, we would like launch products which will give the best-in-class experience to the customers.  Using Credit Card for UPI transactions has been a sought-after feature by the customers.  We are looking for a business strategy intern who is good with SQL, high on analytical thinking, problem solve working closely with the product team and adeptly manage stakeholders with very good communication skills. This project also offers the candidate to be able to do research (Primary & Customer Research), understand the requirements of customers, formulate CVP (Customer Value Proposition), create a business case, understand product and tech efforts involved. Work with cross functional teams to ensure that the product is delivered in decided timelines.


Skill sets: SQL, Problem solving, Stakeholder management, Project management, Strong Communication skills, MS Excel


Traits expectation: Passion to build, analytical thinking, good communication skills, execution focus


Expected learning: opportunity to gather expertise in the credit cards business and lead P&Ls in future. The journey begins with building comfort with number crunching, applied analytical thinking and gathering business knowledge about the broader fintech credit cards domain



Specific courses required for project execution: MS Excel, Analytical thinking, Product thinking, English communication skills

projectGridLines.title: Pricing Analyst
projectGridLines.description:
Description: Building growth levers for the hotels category using discounting, offers and value-drivers. Price modelling: Develop and maintain pricing models to support strategic

?decision-making and ensure profitability. Analyse historical sales data, cost structures, and market demand to provide insights for pricing decisions.


On the data analytics front, you drive end-to-end analytics of all offers, CRM, merchandising, and campaigns and discover insights to increase efficiency, improve reach, and implement these changes iteratively.


Skill sets: Deeply analytical and data-driven thinking


Traits expectation: Passion to build, analytical thinking, good communication skills, execution focus


Expected learning: opportunity to gather expertise in category management and lead P&Ls in future. The journey begins with building comfort with number crunching, applied analytical thinking and gathering business knowledge about the travel space


Specific courses required for project execution:  MS Excel, SQL and data analysis, English Communication skills

projectGridLines.title: Business Analytics for Travel Growth & Customer Experience
projectGridLines.description:
Description: You will work on varied problem statements that help us understand our customer's better and drive significant growth for Scapia travel through actionable insights.


On customer experience, you will get to derive insights looking at all the data around customer chats and support queries. Your insights will help us improve our customer support as well as work with Product teams to build AI solutions for our customers.


Skill sets: Deep knowledge of SQL and data fundamentals. Working knowledge of Python.


Traits expectation: Analytical ability. Structured problem solving and excellent communication skills.


Expected learning: opportunity to analyze large volumes of data, do data modeling, and translate analysis into insights


Specific courses required for project execution:  SQL, Python and data analytics, English Communication Skills
